title: David Byrne
text: Final Year Business Studies Student in DCU (Analytics Specialism), expected to graduate with first-class honours. I have a strong academic record, achieving 613 points in the Leaving Certificate and a 1.1 grade across the first and second years of the Business Studies curriculum. Gained invaluable experience in the Finance industry through a year-long internship with KKR & Co Inc.Â Complemented by certifications in SQL, Python, and financial modeling, I am poised to contribute effectively to an analytical role upon graduation in May 2025.

title: Quarto Test
text:
print("hello world")

hello world



import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: New Enterprise Development
text: Our product, Revive Grounds, is a sustainable skin scrub made using repurposed coffee grounds, and this module gave us the perfect framework to bring it to life. It has been one of the most engaging and practical experiences of my degree so far, offering a strong balance between theory and real-world application. From identifying a clear market opportunity to building investor-ready financials, the process challenged us to think creatively while remaining commercially focused. The Dragonsâ€™ Den pitch was a standout moment, helping us refine our communication and present with confidence to experienced professionals. I also gained a better appreciation for teamwork as we worked closely to develop our brand from the ground up. Overall, the module gave me a much deeper understanding of entrepreneurship and sustainability in business, and helped boost both my practical skills and personal confidence along the way.

title: New Enterprise Development
text: This module has been one of the most engaging and practical experiences of my degree so far. It offered a valuable balance between theory and real-world application, allowing us to bring ideas to life through hands-on business planning, teamwork, and strategic thinking. I particularly appreciated how it challenged us to think creatively while remaining commercially grounded, from identifying market gaps to building investor-ready financials. The Dragonsâ€™ Den experience was a standout highlight, pushing us to refine our communication, pitch with confidence, and receive constructive feedback from real industry professionals. It was also great to work in a collaborative environment that mirrored real startup dynamics, where adaptability and shared leadership were key. Iâ€™ve come away from this module with a stronger understanding of entrepreneurship, branding, and what it takes to bring a sustainable product to market. Overall, itâ€™s boosted both my business knowledge and personal confidence.
